ANIMAL-CONTROL OFFICER
§ 31.170 OFFICE CREATED.
   (A)   There is created the office of Animal-Control Officer.
   (B)   He or she shall be appointed by the Mayor.
   (C)   This person shall possess the qualifications fixed by law.
(Prior Code, § 31.155) (Ord. 74-O-847, passed - -1974)
§ 31.171 APPOINTMENT OF ASSISTANT.
   The Mayor shall appoint an Animal-Control Assistant, if needed.
(Prior Code, § 31.156) (Ord. 74-O-847, passed - -1974)
§ 31.172 OATH AND BOND.
   The Animal-Control Officer shall, before entering upon the duties of his or
her office, take and subscribe the oath of office and shall be bonded in the
same manner as the City Clerk.
(Prior Code, § 31.157) (Ord. 74-O-847, passed - -1974)
§ 31.173 POWERS AND DUTIES.
   (A)   The Animal-Control Officer, in addition to other duties prescribed to
him or her by ordinances and statute, shall enforce all ordinances and laws
relating to the stray animals in the city.
   (B)   The Officer shall patrol all areas of the city for stray animals,
answer all reasonable complaints of the residents related to animals, maintain
detailed and complete records of all animals captured and the disposition
thereof and care for or supervise the care of all animals held in the animal
housing unit.
(Prior Code, § 31.158) (Ord. 74-O-847, passed - -1974)
§ 31.174 QUALIFICATIONS.
   In addition to the qualifications set out in §
31.170 of this chapter, the Officer shall have knowledge of state, county and
city laws relating to stray animals and rabies control and shall be competent
in the handling of dogs and other animals.
(Prior Code, § 31.159) (Ord. 74-O-847, passed - -1974)
§ 31.175 COMPENSATION.
   The compensation for the Animal-Control Officer and Animal-Control Assistant
shall be determined by appropriation by the City Council.
(Prior Code, § 31.160) (Ord. 74-O-847, passed - -1974)
HEALTH OFFICER
§ 31.190 OFFICE CREATED.
   There is hereby created the office of Health Officer. He or she shall be
appointed by the Mayor. His or her compensation shall be determined from time
to time by the appropriation of the City Council. Such person shall possess the
qualifications fixed by law. The Health Officer shall also serve as the
Ordinance Enforcement Officer if so designated and appointed by the Mayor. Such
a designation and appointment does not relieve the Police Department of
ordinance enforcement obligations and duties. The Ordinance Enforcement Officer
is charged with enforcing all valid health and sanitation ordinances of the
city.
(Prior Code, § 31.170) (Ord. 541, passed - -1964; Ord. 74-O-846, passed - -
1974; Ord. 87-O-1278, passed 7-1-1987)
§ 31.191 HEALTH INSPECTOR; APPOINTMENT.
   The city may appoint such full-time and/or part-time Health Inspectors as
may be necessary and compensation for such employment shall be determined from
time to time by the City Council.
(Prior Code, § 31.171) (Ord. 74-O-846, passed - -1974)
§ 31.192 DUTIES AND POWERS OF HEALTH OFFICER.
   (A)   It shall be the duty of the Health Officer to execute and enforce all
statutes of the state, ordinances of the city and regulations and rules of the
Board of Health, relating to health, and to take such other action as is
necessary for the promotion and improvement of the public health, not
inconsistent with the foregoing statutes, ordinances, rules and regulations.
   (B)   Subject to the approval of the City Council, the Health Officer shall
have the power to appoint and remove and to fix the duties of such employees as
may be required to carry out the duties of his or her office.
(Prior Code, § 31.172) (Ord. 541, passed - -1964)
§ 31.193 DUTY TO AID DIRECTOR OF BUILDING AND HOUSING; DEPUTY DIRECTOR OF
BUILDING AND HOUSING.
   (A)   The Health Officer is made a Deputy Director of Building and Housing.
   (B)   It shall be his or her duty to aid the Director of Building and
Housing in administering and enforcing the provisions of building ordinances
pertaining to health and sanitation.
(Prior Code, § 31.173) (Ord. 541, passed - -1964)
§ 31.194 HEARINGS ON VIOLATIONS.
   (A)   When it appears that any health ordinance or regulation of the Board
of Health has been violated, the Health Officer shall cause notice of such fact
to be given to the individual, firm or corporation concerned, who shall be
given an opportunity to be heard concerning such alleged violation.
   (B)   The notice shall specify the date, hour and place of hearing and the
hearing shall be private.
   (C)   If, after such hearing, the Health Officer or other legally qualified
authority believes the ordinance or regulation has been violated, he or she
shall cause the party or parties to be prosecuted.
(Prior Code, § 31.174) (Ord. 541, passed - -1964)
DIRECTOR OF COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT
§ 31.205 OFFICE ESTABLISHED.
   There is created and established the office of Director of Community
Development in and for the city.
(Prior Code, § 31.195) (Ord. 75-O-895, passed - -1975)
§ 31.206 APPOINTMENT.
   The Director of Community Development shall be an officer of the city and
shall be appointed by the Mayor.
(Prior Code, § 31.196) (Ord. 75-O-895, passed - -1975)
§ 31.207 TERM OF OFFICE.
   The term of office of the Director of Community Development shall be for a
period of one year and until a successor has been appointed and has qualified
as provided by law.
(Prior Code, § 31.197) (Ord. 75-O-895, passed - -1975)
§ 31.208 QUALIFICATIONS.
   No person shall qualify for appointment to the office of Director of
Community Development unless he or she has done the following:
   (A)   Accumulated not less than 50 college credit hours from a duly
accredited college or university, or colleges and universities;
   (B)   Acquired a working knowledge of federal assistance programs such as,
but not limited to:
      (1)   Housing;
      (2)   Employment;
      (3)   Industrial development; or
      (4)   Education.
   (C)   Possesses general ability to organize and supervise general office
administration and staff.
(Prior Code, § 31.198) (Ord. 75-O-895, passed - -1975)
§ 31.209 DUTIES.
   Subject to the direction of the Mayor, the Director of Community Development
shall be engaged in such duties as may from time to time be found appropriate
in such areas as, but not limited to: employment programs; housing programs;
industrial and community development programs and educational program, whether
funded in whole or in part by the Federal Government, either directly or
indirectly, which duties shall include, by way of example and not limitation,
the establishment of local guidelines for such programs as set out in this
section, investigation for and procurement of funding for such programs and
maintenance of supervisory authority over and responsibility for any and all
reports and procedures which may be required under such programs. The duties of
the Director of Community Development shall specifically include cooperation
with other governmental agencies in the procurement of funding for and the
operation of such programs as set out in this section.
(Prior Code, § 31.199) (Ord. 75-O-895, passed - -1975)
§ 31.210 COMPENSATION.
   Compensation for the office of Director of Community Development shall be as
determined by the City Council in the annual appropriation ordinance.
(Prior Code, § 31.200) (Ord. 75-O-895, passed - -1975)
DIRECTOR OF BUILDING AND HOUSING
§ 31.225 OFFICE CREATED.
   (A)   There is created the office of Director of Building and Housing who
shall, head the Building and Housing Department. Every reference to “Building
Inspector” and “Director of the Department of Housing” in the ordinances of the
city shall be replaced with the new title of “Director of Building and
Housing”.
   (B)   The Director of Building and Housing shall be appointed by the Mayor.
The Building and Housing Department shall consist of a Plumbing Inspector,
Electrical Inspector, Heating and Ventilation Inspector, Board of Examiners and
Appeals, assistants, clerical employees and such other officers and employees,
as the City Council may provide by ordinance. All officers and employees of the
Building and Housing Department shall be under the direction of supervision of
the Director of Building and Housing and shall perform such duties as may be
required of them by the Director of Building and Housing, or as set forth by
ordinance.
(Ord. 08-O-1921, passed 4-16-2008)
§ 31.226 QUALIFICATIONS.
   The Director of Building and Housing shall be a citizen of the United States
and shall have at least two years of previous experience in general
construction work. The Inspector shall have a working knowledge of blueprints
and plans and be able to read, interpret and understand same.
(Prior Code, § 31.211) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.227 OATH AND BOND.
   Before entering upon the duties of his or her office, the Director of
Building and Housing shall take and subscribe the oath of office and shall
execute, acknowledge and deliver to the city a good and sufficient bond with
two or more sureties conditioned for the faithful discharge of the duties of
his office in the penal sum of $5,000. The bond shall meet with the approval of
the City Council.
(Prior Code, § 31.212) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.228 DUTIES.
   (A)   It shall be the duty of the Director of Building and Housing to see to
the enforcement of all ordinance provisions relating to building and zoning and
to inspect all buildings or structures being erected or altered as frequently
as may be necessary to ensure compliance with the city ordinances.
   (B)   The Director of Building and Housing shall devote such time to his or
her duties as shall be necessary for the efficient operation of the Building
and Housing Department. The position of Director of Building and Housing is
deemed a full-time position.
(Prior Code, § 31.213) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.229 REPORTS AND RECORDS.
   The Director of Building and Housing shall submit a report to the City
Council not less than once a month covering the work of the Building and
Housing Department during the preceding period. The Inspector shall incorporate
in said report a summary of his or her recommendations as to desirable
amendments to the law.
(Prior Code, § 31.214) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.230 POWERS.
   (A)   The Director of Building and Housing is authorized and empowered to
enforce all ordinance provisions relating to building and zoning and to inspect
the construction, equipment, alteration, repair, moving or demolition of all
buildings and other structures.
   (B)   The Director of Building and Housing shall have the power to make or
cause to be made, entry into any building or premise when necessary in the
performance of his or her duties at any reasonable hour. For such purpose he
shall have the powers of a police officer. The Inspector shall have authority
to call upon the Police Department for aid and assistance, and it shall be the
duty of the Police Department, when so called upon, to cooperate with the
Director of Building and Housing in order to enforce the provisions of
municipal ordinances.
   (C)   The Director of Building and Housing shall have the power to order all
work stopped on construction or alteration or repair of buildings in the city,
when such work is being done in violation of any provision of any ordinance
relating thereto, or in violation of the Zoning Code. Work shall not be resumed
after the issuance of such an order, except on the written permission of the
Inspector; provided that, if the stop order is an oral one, it shall be
followed by a written stop order within an hour. Such written stop order may be
served by any police officer.
   (D)   If a builder has built a number of homes in a subdivision contrary to
the provisions of the Building Code, the Director of Building and Housing may
order the work stopped on all homes in the same subdivision until such time as
the deficiencies are remedied. The stop order shall be delivered in writing to
any persons engaged in the construction of any of the homes in the subdivision,
and all such persons shall stop such work until permitted to proceed by action
of the Director of Building and Housing.
(Prior Code, § 31.215) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.231 INDEMNIFICATION.
   Whenever the Director of Building and Housing is acting for the city in the
discharge of his or her official duties under this subchapter and shall, by
reason of any official act or in the performance of such duty, be subjected to
any suit, such suit shall be defended by the City Attorney at the cost of the
city until the final determination of the proceedings thereunder.
(Prior Code, § 31.216) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.232 COMPENSATION.
   The Director of Building and Housing shall receive as compensation for
services rendered an amount as may be determined by the City Council by
ordinance.
(Prior Code, § 31.217) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.233 NON-COMPLIANCE WITH ORDERS.
   No person, firm or corporation shall violate any of the provisions of this
subchapter or any order of a duly appointed inspector.
(Prior Code, § 31.218) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
ELECTRICAL INSPECTOR
§ 31.245 OFFICE CREATED.
   There is created the office of Electrical Inspector who shall be appointed
by the Mayor.
(Prior Code, § 31.230) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.246 QUALIFICATIONS.
   The person certified to fill the position of Electrical Inspector shall be
an electrical engineer or an efficient electrician with at least two years’
experience in electrical installation.
(Prior Code, § 31.231) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.247 OATH AND BOND.
   Before entering upon the duties of his or her office, the Electrical
Inspector shall take and subscribe to the oath of office and shall execute,
acknowledge and deliver to the city a good and sufficient bond with two or more
sureties conditioned for the faithful discharge of his or her duties of his or
her office. The bond shall meet with the approval of the City Council.
(Prior Code, § 31.232) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.248 DUTIES.
   It shall be the duty of the Electrical Inspector to see to the enforcement
of all provisions of the codes and ordinances of the city relating to
electrical installations; and to make such investigations and perform such
duties as may be necessary in the enforcement of such codes and ordinances.
(Prior Code, § 31.233) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.249 POWERS.
   (A)   The Electrical Inspector is authorized and empowered to enforce all
code and ordinance provisions relating to electrical installation and
equipment.
   (B)   No electrical installation shall be covered, enclosed or closed in
until approved by the Electrical Inspector.
   (C)   The Electrical Inspector shall have the power to order work stopped on
the construction, alteration or repair of electrical installations when such
work is being done in violation of any ordinance. Work shall not be resumed
after the issuance of such a stop order, except on written permission of the
Electrical Inspector; provided that, if the stop-work is an oral one it shall
be followed by a written stop order within one hour.
(Prior Code, § 31.234) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.250 COMPENSATION.
   The Electrical Inspector shall receive as compensation for services rendered
the sum of $100 per month or such other amount as may be determined by the City
Council by ordinance.
(Prior Code, § 31.235) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.251 NON-COMPLIANCE WITH ORDERS.
   No person, firm or corporation shall violate any of the provisions of this
subchapter or any order of a duly appointed inspector.
(Prior Code, § 31.236) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
PLUMBING INSPECTOR
§ 31.265 OFFICE CREATED.
   There is created the office of Plumbing Inspector who shall be appointed by
the Mayor.
(Prior Code, § 31.245) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.266 QUALIFICATIONS.
   The person certified to fill the position of Plumbing Inspector shall be a
sanitary engineer or a licensed plumber with at least two years’ experience in
plumbing installation work.
(Prior Code, § 31.246) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.267 OATH AND BOND.
   Before entering upon the duties of his or her office, the Plumbing Inspector
shall take and subscribe the oath of office and shall execute, acknowledge and
deliver to the city a good and sufficient bond with two or more sureties
conditioned for the faithful discharge of his or her duties of his or her
office. The bond shall meet with the approval of the City Council.
(Prior Code, § 31.247) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.268 DUTIES.
   It shall be the duty of the Plumbing Inspector to see to the enforcement of
all provisions of the codes and ordinances of the city relating to plumbing and
plumbing equipment; and to make such investigations and perform such duties as
may be necessary in the enforcement of such codes and ordinances.
(Prior Code, § 31.248) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.269 POWERS.
   (A)   The Plumbing Inspector is authorized and empowered to enforce all code
and ordinance provisions relating to plumbing and plumbing equipment.
   (B)   No plumbing installation shall be covered, enclosed or closed in until
an approval seal of inspection shall have been applied to the installation by
the Plumbing Inspector.
   (C)   The Plumbing Inspector shall have the power to order work stopped on
the construction, alteration or repair of plumbing equipment when such work is
being done in violation of any provision of this code or ordinance. Work shall
not be resumed after the issuance of such a stop order, except in written
permission of the Plumbing Inspector; provided that, if the stop order is an
oral one it shall be followed by a written stop order within one hour.
(Prior Code, § 31.249) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.270 COMPENSATION.
   The Plumbing Inspector shall receive as compensation for services rendered
in the sum as set by Council by ordinance.
(Prior Code, § 31.250) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.271 NON-COMPLIANCE WITH ORDERS.
   No person, firm or corporation shall violate any of the provisions of this
subchapter or any order of a duly appointed inspector.
(Prior Code, § 31.251) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
HEATING AND VENTILATION INSPECTOR
§ 31.285 OFFICE CREATED.
   There is created the office of Heating and Ventilation Inspector who shall
be appointed by the Mayor.
(Prior Code, § 31.260) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.286 QUALIFICATIONS.
   The person certified to fill the position of Heating and Ventilation
Inspector shall be a mechanical engineer or an efficient mechanic with at least
two years’ experience in the design or installation of warm-air heating, air-
conditioning and ventilating equipment.
(Prior Code, § 31.261) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.287 OATH AND BOND.
   Before entering upon the duties of his or her office, the Heating and
Ventilation Inspector shall take and subscribe the oath of office and shall
execute, acknowledge and deliver to the city a good and sufficient bond with
two or more sureties conditioned for the faithful discharge of his or her
duties of his or her office. The bond shall meet with the approval of the City
Council.
(Prior Code, § 31.262) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.288 DUTIES.
   It shall be the duty of the Heating and Ventilation Inspector to see to the
enforcement of all provisions of this code and any ordinances of the city
relating to heating, air-conditioning and ventilating equipment; and to make
such investigations and perform such duties as may be necessary in the
enforcement of such provisions.
(Prior Code, § 31.263) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.289 POWERS.
   (A)   The Heating and Ventilation Inspector is authorized and empowered to
enforce all code and ordinance provisions relating to heating, air-conditioning
and ventilating equipment.
   (B)   No heating, air-conditioning or ventilating installation shall be
covered, enclosed or closed in until approved by the Heating and Ventilation
Inspector.
   (C)   (1)   The Heating and Ventilation Inspector shall have the power to
order work stopped on the construction, alteration or repair or heating, air-
conditioning and ventilating equipment when such work is being done in
violation of this code or any ordinance.
      (2)   Work shall not be resumed after the issuance of such a stop order,
except on written permission of the Heating and Ventilation Inspector; provided
that, if the stop order is an oral one, it shall be followed by a written stop
order within one hour.
(Prior Code, § 31.264) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.290 COMPENSATION.
   The Heating and Ventilation Inspector shall receive as compensation for
services rendered as may be determined by the City Council by ordinance.
(Prior Code, § 31.265) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 31.291 NON-COMPLIANCE WITH ORDERS.
   No person, firm or corporation shall violate any of the provisions of this
subchapter or any order of a duly appointed inspector.
(Prior Code, § 31.266) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
SUPERINTENDENT OF PUBLIC WORKS
§ 31.305 POSITION CREATED.
   (A)   There is created the office of Superintendent of Public Works.
   (B)   He or she shall be appointed by and responsible to the Mayor. He or
she shall have the management and control of all matters and things pertaining
to public works.
   (C)   The Superintendent shall be paid a salary as appropriated and fixed by
the City Council.
   (D)   The Superintendent shall carry out such duties as are assigned to him
or her by the Mayor.
(Prior Code, § 31.275) (Ord. 73-O-829, passed - -1973)
§ 31.306 DUTIES.
   (A)   Additional duties of Superintendent. The Superintendent of Public
Works shall, subject to the provisions of this code and other ordinances of the
city, take special charge and superintendence of:
      (1)   All public grounds in the city;
      (2)   All public buildings in the city belonging to the city;
      (3)   Maintenance and repair, including inspections and permits and
licenses required, of all public streets, curbs, alleys and sidewalks in the
city, and surveys, studies and the preparation of plans and specifications for
the extending, constructing or reconstructing of streets or thoroughfares,
curbs, alleys and sidewalks in the city;
      (4)   The planning and construction of traffic facilities for existing
and proposed streets;
      (5)   Establishment of city benchmarks from city data and, after approval
by the Mayor and City Council, recording of these benchmark locations and
elevations. The Superintendent shall maintain a record of all streets, sewer,
drainage ditch elevations established by other agencies and approved by the
Mayor and City Council. The Superintendent shall be responsible for
establishment of additional elevations and grade for streets, sewers, drainage
ditches and the like, as may be required in the performance of his or her
duties as otherwise set forth in this division (A);
      (6)   All garbage and waste disposal and all equipment of the city owned
or used in connection with the final disposition of garbage, refuse and waste.
He or she shall submit reports, as required by the City Council, to the Mayor
and City Council of the operation of all activities of waste disposal;
      (7)   All local improvements including improvements paid for in whole or
in part by special assessments upon their completion, acceptance by the Board
of Local Improvements, or upon their completion, acceptance and approval by the
court confirming the assessment;
      (8)   The operation and maintenance of the waterworks and sewer systems
of the city, including inspections and permits and licenses required for the
extension, installation, repair or relocation of water and sewer facilities,
and keeping of records of all underground lines, taps and the like;
      (9)   The construction, operation and maintenance of all city parks,
public squares, triangles and other open spaces at street intersections,
playgrounds, swimming pools, public comfort stations, street parkways and of
all trees, plants and shrubs planted and to be planted in the public ways of
the city;
      (10)   Maps and plats of the city relating to geographical and
topographical data, watercourses, public ways or other public places, house
numbers, water and sewer systems and all other matters requiring maps or plats
including the vacation of public ways, the opening of new subdivisions and the
changing or altering of the physical characteristics of any parts of the
territory now or hereafter comprised within the limits of the city;
      (11)   The requisitioning, ordering, receiving and inventorying of the
necessary supplies and materials for the normal operations of the various
public works under his or her jurisdiction. Purchase orders for “Class E” items
costing $10 to $50 as described in the city purchase order procedure may be
approved by the Superintendent of Public Works if countersigned by the Mayor or
Chairperson of the Finance Committee. The Superintendent shall also check and
approve or disapprove all invoices for materials ordered for the Department of
Public Works;
      (12)   Submitting from time to time to the Mayor and Council, through the
appropriate chairperson, recommendations for stock or inventory levels of
normal or recurring maintenance or operating supplies and materials. Such
inventory levels, after Board approval, shall be maintained until revised at
the recommendation of the Superintendent of Public Works or the appropriate
committee chairperson;
      (13)   Making of recommendations to the City Council for appropriation of
funds for the operations of the public works under his or her jurisdiction
through the chairperson of the committee or organization concerned;
      (14)   Keeping a record of appropriations of moneys made for the public
works under his or her jurisdiction, and the expenditure of such moneys so that
the financial situation of all projects under his or her jurisdiction may be
readily determined. The records and all papers and files of the department
shall be at all times open to the examination of the Finance Committee, or any
member of the City Council; and
      (15)   Making a report at least monthly to the Mayor and Council through
the chairperson of the committee or organization concerned regarding progress
of work, planned work or any other matter that may be appropriate.
   (B)   Street improvements and cleaning.
      (1)   The Superintendent of Public Works shall have charge of and
supervision over and direction of construction and reconstruction and
maintenance of all street improvements, sidewalks, crosswalks, drains, ditches,
curbs and gutters, culverts, crossing bridges, viaducts, subways and other
improvements and repair thereof, except when such improvements or repairs are
paid for by special assessment. The Superintendent shall also have charge of
and the supervision over and direction of the cleaning and sprinkling of
streets, alleys and public places.
      (2)   All public improvements described in division (A) above shall be
made in conformity with specifications laid down from time to time by the Mayor
and City Council.
(Prior Code, § 31.276)
§ 31.307 PERSONNEL AND ADVISORY FUNCTIONS.
   The Superintendent of Public Works may engage day labor at established
hourly rates to perform any work required by and authorized for his or her
department, and may accept orders from any other department or branch of the
city government upon proper requisition and authority, for repair and
construction work. The Superintendent shall hire part-time help as required,
and shall make recommendations to the City Council for employment of salaries
personnel. The Superintendent discharge any employee of his or her Department,
the discharge to be subject to review by the Mayor and City Council. The
Superintendent shall, when requested by a member of the Council, render
technical advice and/or assistance regarding any city problem.
(Prior Code, § 31.277)
§ 31.308 ANNUAL ESTIMATE OF EXPENDITURES.
   The Superintendent of Public Works shall on or before April 1 in each year
submit to the Mayor and City Council a statement, as nearly as can be
estimated, of the repairs and improvements of the Department of Public Works to
be paid for out of the funds of the city and necessary to be undertaken by the
city during the ensuing year. He or she shall also submit a statement as to any
desired improvements, with the probable costs thereof, and all contracts made
and unfinished, and the amount of any and all unexpended balances of
appropriations of the current and prior years. The report shall be in detail.
The Mayor and Council having revised, changed or altered the estimates as
submitted may provide revenue for the same in the annual appropriation
ordinance or in such other manner as may be provided by law.
(Prior Code, § 31.278)
§ 31.309 ISSUANCE OF PERMITS.
   In all cases where provision is made in this code that the consent of the
Superintendent of Public Works shall be obtained to authorize any act to be
done, he or she may grant a permit therefor, subject to the restrictions of the
provisions of this code.
(Prior Code, § 31.279)
§ 31.310 APPOINTMENT OF FIELD SUPERINTENDENT OF PUBLIC WORKS.
   (A)   There is created the office of Field Superintendent of Public Works.
The Field Superintendent shall be appointed by the Mayor with the concurrence
of the City Council.
   (B)   The Field Superintendent is directly responsible to the Superintendent
of Public Works. He or she shall carry out such duties as are assigned to him
or her under the direction of the Superintendent of Public Works. He or she
shall be paid a salary as appropriated and fixed by the City Council.
(Prior Code, § 31.280) (Ord. 85-O-1188, passed 7-20-1985)
§ 31.311 PUBLIC WORKS SECRETARY.
   (A)   There is hereby created the position of Public Works Secretary.
   (B)   The Secretary shall be appointed by the Mayor with the advice and
consent of the City Council. Appointment to this position created by ordinance
may be made from time to time.
   (C)   The person appointed to the position of Public Works Secretary shall
have a high school diploma or GED supplemented training in business and
secretarial work or a combination of training and experience which provided
equivalent knowledge, abilities and skills. In addition, the person shall have
a thorough knowledge of business, grammar, math, computers (word processing and
data spreadsheets), secretarial/office practice and procedures and the ability
to effectively communicate with the public and solve department related
problems.
   (D)   The Public Works Secretary shall type correspondence and reports,
utilize telephone system to make, receive and respond to telephone calls,
handle inquiries and complaints, prepare, maintain and submit required reports,
log information and documentation into ledgers, schedule water samplings, serve
as a Deputy Election Registrar and assist the window clerk when necessary.
   (E)   The Pubic Works Secretary shall perform such other duties as may be
assigned or delegated by the Superintendent of Public Works or Mayor.
   (F)   The Pubic Works Secretary shall receive as compensation for services
performed such sum as set from time to time by ordinance.
(Ord. 08-O-1918, passed 4-2-2008)
COMMUNITY SERVICES OFFICER
§ 31.325 OFFICE CREATED.
   There is created the office of Community Service Officer. Such officer shall
be appointed by the Mayor and shall possess the qualifications fixed by the
Illinois Revised Statutes for elected city officials.
(Prior Code, § 31.290) (Ord. 74-O-849, passed - -1974)
§ 31.326 OATH AND BOND.
   A Community Service Officer shall, before entering upon the duties of his or
er office, taken and subscribe the oath of office and shall be bonded in the
same manner as the City Clerk.
(Prior Code, § 31.291) (Ord. 74-O-849, passed - -1974)
§ 31.327 POWERS AND DUTIES.
   A Community Service Officer shall do the following:
   (A)   Assist citizens who are seeking public assistance to properly apply
for and quality for such assistance;
   (B)   Coordinate local government and private service organizations and seek
to provide beneficial working arrangements between them;
   (C)   Try to establish a Planned Parenthood program for the city;
   (D)   Work in cooperation with the Harvey Neighborhood-Youth Center, the
Bremen Youth Commission and all other youth organizations which deal with city
youth; and
   (E)   Establish youth and senior citizens’ programs and seek federal, state
and county assistance for such programs.
(Prior Code, § 31.292) (Ord. 74-O-849, passed - -1974)
PERSONNEL DIRECTOR
§ 31.340 POSITION CREATED.
   There is created the office of Personnel Director within the administrative
staff of the city as an executive office of the city. The Personnel Director
shall be appointed by the Mayor with the advice and consent of the City
Council.
(Prior Code, § 31.295) (Ord. 96-O-1583, passed 7-23-1996)
§ 31.341 AUTHORITY.
   (A)   The Personnel Director shall have supervisory authority as may be from
time to time designated by the Mayor in writing.
   (B)   The authority shall pertain to those administrative employees and
departments as shall be designated by the Mayor.
(Prior Code, § 31.296) (Ord. 96-O-1583, passed 7-23-1996)
§ 31.342 QUALIFICATIONS.
   The Personnel Director shall be qualified by training, experience or both to
handle the requirements and duties of the office. Academic degrees may be
considered, but no specific academic degree shall be required as a minimum
qualification.
(Prior Code, § 31.297) (Ord. 96-O-1583, passed 7-23-1996)
§ 31.343 DUTIES.
   The Personnel Director shall provide performance audits from time to time of
both employees and city departments for the purpose of determining whether the
employee and/or department is, in fact, achieving the general objectives
established, including both appropriate beneficial relations with the public
and the delivery of services required and expected of the city.
(Prior Code, § 31.298) (Ord. 96-O-1583, passed 7-23-1996)
§ 31.344 SALARY.
   The salary or compensation of such officer shall be in the amount set by
Council and included as a line item in the Corporate Fund of the annual budget.
(Prior Code, § 31.299) (Ord. 96-O-1583, passed 7-23-1996)
OTHER MUNICIPAL EMPLOYEES
§ 31.355 ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT.
   (A)   The Mayor may appoint an Administrative Assistant who shall serve at
the pleasure of the Mayor and perform the following duties:
      (1)   The Mayor’s Administrative Assistant, subject to the direction and
control of the Mayor, shall supervise the administrative management of all city
boards, commissions and other city agencies established by the ordinances of
the city and the laws of the state;
      (2)   In addition to such supervisory power, the Mayor’s administrative
assistant may, in respect to any or all agencies under this supervision,
establish reporting procedures, require the submission of progress reports and
provide for the coordination of the activities of such agencies;
      (3)   The Administrative Assistant shall make periodic reports with
recommendations to the Mayor concerning the administrative management of all
boards, commissions and agencies of the city;
      (4)   The Administrative Assistant shall preserve and keep in the Mayor’s
office all books and papers which are customarily filed or required by law to
be filed therein; shall deliver to the City Council and the respective
department of the city, all messages from the Mayor in writing and attend the
Mayor’s office during the usual office hours; and
      (5)   The Administrative Assistant shall perform such other
administrative and executive functions as may be delegated by the Mayor.
   (B)   The Mayor’s Administrative Assistant shall receive as compensation for
services performed such sum as shall be set from time to time by ordinance.
(Prior Code, § 31.305) (Ord. 71-O-783, passed - -1971)
§ 31.356 OFFICIAL MUNICIPAL PHOTOGRAPHER.
   (A)   There is created the position of Official Municipal Photographer for
the city. The Official Municipal Photographer shall be appointed by the Mayor
for a term not exceeding one year. He or she shall receive such compensation as
the City Council may provide by ordinance.
   (B)   Under the direction and supervision of the Mayor and Chief of Police,
the Official Municipal Photographer shall take all pictures and photographs
required by the city for official use. He or she shall perform his or her
duties only when directed by the Mayor or Chief of Police and shall submit a
monthly report of all his or her activities to that date.
   (C)   The Official Municipal Photographer shall receive an official
commission under the signature of the Mayor and be entitled to a municipal
badge. When authorized by the Mayor or Chief of Police, he or she shall be
authorized to go upon private property for the purpose of taking official
photographs and pictures.
   (D)   The Official Municipal Photographer shall continue in the performance
of his or her duties subject to the approval of the Mayor. He or she may be
removed from office at any time for failure to perform the duties assigned to
him or her or for misconduct.
(Prior Code, § 31.306) (Ord. 69-O-712, passed - -1969)
§ 31.357 WATER SUPPLY OPERATOR.
   (A)   There is established the position of Public Water Supply Operator for
the city.
   (B)   The position of Public Water Supply Operator shall be filled only by
an individual certified as a public water supply operator as by statute made
and provided.
   (C)   The public water supply operator shall be an employee of the city
entitled to the benefits and subject to the rules and regulations attendant
such status.
(Prior Code, § 31.307) (Ord. 74-O-861, passed - -1974)
§ 31.358 INSPECTOR GENERAL.
   (A)   There is hereby created the position of Inspector General.
   (B)   The Inspector General shall be appointed by the Mayor with the advice
and consent of the City Council. Appointment to this position created by
ordinance may be made from time to time.
   (C)   The duties of the person appointed to the position of Inspector
General shall include, but not be limited to: reviewing and reporting on the
management and operation of each department; providing recommendations and
information on how to promote economy, efficiency and effectiveness within each
department; receiving complaints alleging wrongful acts or omissions by
employees and determine whether the information contained in those complaints
allege facts that give reasonable cause to investigate further; detecting,
investigating, deterring and preventing fraud, waste and abuse within each
department; providing periodic analyses, evaluations and appraisals of each
department; and providing information on issues and deficiencies relating to
compliance with each department’s rules, regulations, laws, policies and
procedures.
   (D)   The Inspector General shall perform such other duties as may be
assigned or delegated by the Mayor.
   (E)   The Inspector General shall receive as compensation for services
performed such sum as set from time to time by ordinance.
(Ord. 11-O-1989, passed 5-18-2011)
§ 31.359 ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE COORDINATOR.
   (A)   There is hereby created the position of Accounts Receivable
Coordinator.
   (B)   The Accounts Receivable Coordinator shall be appointed by the Mayor

Receivable Coordinator shall include those set forth in “Exhibit A” attached to
the ordinance codified herein.
   (D)   The Accounts Receivable Coordinator shall perform such other duties as
may be assigned or delegated by the Treasurer or Mayor.
   (E)   The Accounts Receivable Coordinator shall be a full-time position and
receive as compensation for services performed such sum as set from time to
time by ordinance.
(Ord. 17-O-2179, passed 4-19-2017)

   (A)   There is hereby created the position of Accounts Payable Coordinator.
   (B)   The Accounts Payable Coordinator shall be appointed by the Mayor with
the advice and consent of the City Council. Appointment to this position

   (C)   The duties of the person appointed to the position of Accounts Payable

(Ord. 17-O-2178, passed 4-19-2017)
§ 31.361 ASSISTANT CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER.
   (A)   There is hereby created the position of Assistant Chief Financial
Officer.
   (B)   The Assistant Chief Financial Officer shall be appointed by the Mayor
with the advice and consent of the City Council. Appointment to this position
created by ordinance may be made from time to time.
   (C)   The duties of the person appointed to the position of Assistant Chief
Financial Officer shall be as follows: oversee day-to-day operations, while
teaching and facilitating discussion surrounding business concept techniques
and practices covering city-related topics; accounting, bookkeeping, payroll,
revenue, budget and forecasting; work closely with department heads and
external auditors to complete year end audits, tax increment financing (TIF)
district audits, city audits, AFR reports and library, park district, police
and fire pension audits; develop accounting processes and procedures; assist in
preparing the city’s annual budget; analyze capital projects and debt service;
prepare a financial model for long-term financial planning (trend monitoring
and forecasting); prepare monthly financial statements; audit general ledger
accounts, payroll, employee benefits, water revenue accounts and make monthly
adjustments; attend staff and union negotiation meetings; assist and review all
union wage calculations prior to disbursement; and attend City Council meetings
as requested.
   (D)   The Assistant Chief Financial Officer shall perform such other duties
as may be assigned or delegated by the Treasurer or Mayor.
   (E)   The Assistant Chief Financial officer shall be a full-time position
and receive as compensation for services performed such sum as set from time to
time by ordinance.
(Ord. 15-O-2119A, passed 7-1-2015)
§ 31.362 HUMAN RESOURCES GENERALIST.
   (A)   There is hereby created the position of Human Resources Generalist.
   (B)   The Human Resources Generalist shall be appointed by the Mayor with
the advice and consent of the City Council. Appointment to this position
created by ordinance may be made from time to time.
   (C)   The duties of the person appointed to the position of Human Resources
Generalist shall include, but not be limited to: maintaining all personnel
records for the city; assisting with employment recruitment; preparing and
submitting payroll to the Treasurer’s office; maintaining the city’s human
resources information systems; creating and maintaining electronic human
resources forms; maintaining employee benefits information; developing and
conducting employee training; processing worker’s compensation claims and
assisting with insurance and safety matters; drafting human resources policies
and procedures; completing compliance reports; attending seminars, conferences
and meetings relating to human resources issues; assisting with creating a
human resources department budget; attending City Council, department, safety
and training and other meetings, as needed; following safe practices; and
learning rules, regulations, laws, policies and procedures relating to
employees.
   (D)   The Human Resources Generalist shall perform such other duties as may
be assigned or delegated by the Human Resources Director or Mayor.
   (E)   The Human Resources Generalist shall be a full-time position and
receive as compensation for services performed such sum as set from time to
time by ordinance.
(Ord. 13-O-2071, passed 11-20-2013)
§ 31.363 CHIEF OF STAFF.
   (A)   There is hereby created the position of Chief of Staff.
   (B)   The Chief of Staff shall be appointed by the Mayor with the advice and
consent of the City Council. Appointment to this position created by ordinance
may be made from time to time.
   (C)   The duties of the person appointed to the position of Chief of Staff
shall include, but not be limited to: advising the Mayor and providing
extensive professional assistance and recommendations on city issues, municipal
operations and labor matters to the Mayor, department heads and/or appointed
officials. The Chief of Staff shall facilitate, coordinate and supervise the
work of all city departments and work to successfully implement the policies of
the administration. The Chief of Staff shall serve as liaison between the Mayor
and department heads, appointed officials and public and represent the Mayor
when necessary. The Chief of Staff shall assist the Mayor with management of
department heads and appointed officials. The Chief of Staff shall coordinate
projects and programs from conception to completion. The Chief of Staff shall
establish job descriptions and set goals for department heads and appointed
officials and implement strategies to meet those goals.
   (D)   The Chief of Staff shall perform such other duties as may be assigned
or delegated by the Mayor.
   (E)   The Chief of Staff shall receive as compensation for services
performed such sum as set from time to time by ordinance.
(Ord. 10-O-1966B, passed 4-7-2010)
§ 31.364 PUBLIC RELATIONS ADMINISTRATOR.
   (A)   The Public Relations Administrator shall receive a annual salary as an
independent contractor, payable without deductions commencing with passage and
approval of this section and payment issued on the first of each month.
   (B)   His or her duties shall be those assigned to him or her by the Mayor.
(Ord. 07-O-1884, passed 3-7-2007)
§ 31.365 CITY ADMINISTRATOR/DIRECTOR OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT.
   (A)   There is hereby created the position of City Administrator/Director of
Economic Development.
   (B)   The City Administrator/Director of Economic Development shall be
appointed by the Mayor with the advice and consent of the City Council.
Appointment to this position created by ordinance may be made from time to
time.
   (C)   The duties of the person appointed to the position of City
Administrator/Director of Economic Development shall include, but not be
limited to, advising the Mayor and City Council; defining goals and performance
objectives necessary for the proper and efficient operation of the city;
implementing strategies to attain goals and performance objectives; monitoring
and reporting progress of goals and performance objectives; designing,
implementing and monitoring economic development projects and programs; serving
as a liaison between property owners, businesses, city staff and others
regarding economic development projects and programs; preparing and submitting
applications and proposals for funding city economic development projects and
programs to county, state and federal government offices, departments and
agencies and non-government entities; monitoring funding received from county,
state and federal government offices, departments and agencies and non-
government entities for projects and programs; ensuring compliance with
guidelines of county, state and non-government entities relating to funds
received for projects and programs; completing and submitting reports required
by county, state and federal government offices, departments and agencies and
non-government entities; maintaining city economic development data; attending
Planning and Zoning Board meetings and any other meetings as directed;
performing research; working on municipal zoning map and census matters;
meeting goals established by the Mayor; becoming a member of position related
professional organizations; attending position related seminars and
conferences; and presenting a monthly report of all work performed to the
Mayor.
   (D)   The City Administrator/Director of Economic Development shall perform
such other duties as may be assigned or delegated by the Mayor.
   (E)   The City Administrator/Director of Economic Development shall receive
as compensation for services performed such sum as set from time to time by
ordinance.
(Ord. 20-O-2277, passed 8-5-2020)
§ 31.366 ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES COORDINATOR.
   (A)   That there is hereby created the position of Administrative Services
Coordinator.
   (B)   The Administrative Services Coordinator shall be appointed by the
Mayor with the advice and consent of the City Council. Appointment to this
position created by ordinance may be made from time to time.
   (C)   The duties of the person appointed to the position of Administrative
Services Coordinator shall include, but not be limited to, advising the Mayor;
planning, coordinating and implementing administrative services; managing
records and information; providing additional office support services;
developing and implementing comprehensive policies and procedures and a job
flow chart for the Building and Housing Department; overseeing and ensuring
compliance with fee collection process for business licenses, permits, tickets
and other related fees; organizing and assisting with maintenance of Building
Department files and documents; inputting and posting checks, cash and other
revenues into city accounting system; processing bi-weekly payroll; monitoring
employee timecard reporting; preparing and filing monthly IMRF returns;
assisting with tracking of daily accounts receivable deposits and balances due;
recommending process and procedure improvements; participating in cross
training and additional job training; assisting with FOIA research and
compliance; assisting with city project implementation; cross training for
accounts payable functions; attending monthly safety committee meetings;
helping ensure city compliance with Union contracts; implementing strategies to
attain goals and objectives established by the city; reporting on matters
related to the position of Administrative Services Coordinator; and presenting
a monthly report of all work performed to the Mayor.
   (D)   The Administrative Services Coordinator shall perform such other
duties as may be assigned or delegated by the Mayor.
   (E)   That the Administrative Services Coordinator shall receive as
compensation for services performed such sum as set from time to time by
ordinance.
(Ord. 20-O-2278, passed 8-5-2020)
§ 31.999 PENALTY.
   (A)   Any person violating any provision of this chapter for which no
specific penalty is prescribed shall be subject to §
10.99 of this code of ordinances.
   (B)   Any person, firm or corporation violating any of the terms of §
31.002 of this chapter shall, upon conviction thereof, be fined not less than
$25, not more than $200, and each day upon which such violation shall occur is
deemed a separate offense.
   (C)   Any person, firm or corporation violating any of the provisions of §§
31.233,
31.251,
31.271 and
31.291 of this chapter shall, upon conviction, be fined not less than $5, nor
more than $50, for each offense. A separate offense is deemed committed each
day on which any work in violation of such order is done.
(Prior Code, § 31.999) (Ord. 470, passed - -1962; Ord. 69-O-697, passed - -
1968)

DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WORKS
§ 32.001 ESTABLISHMENT.
   There is created an executive department of the municipal government which
shall be known as the “Department of Public Works”. The Department shall
embrace the Superintendent of Public Works and such other officers and
employees as are designated in this code and such as the City Council may
provide by the annual appropriation ordinance.
(Prior Code, § 32.001)
§ 32.002 DIVISIONS OF DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC WORKS.
   The Department of Pubic Works shall hereafter consist of two departments,
the Water and Sewer Department and the Street Department.
(Prior Code, § 32.002) (Ord. 03-O-1752, passed 4-2-2003)
§ 32.003 ESTABLISHMENT OF OTHER DEPARTMENTS UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF PUBLIC
WORKS DEPARTMENT.
   There is established a Department of Streets and Public Improvements, which
shall be under the supervision of the Superintendent of Public Works.
(Prior Code, § 32.003)
DEPARTMENT OF URBAN DEVELOPMENT
§ 32.015 DEPARTMENT CREATED.
   There is established a Department of Urban Development of the city, which
shall consist of three members. One member shall be the Director of the
Department of Urban Development who shall be appointed by the Mayor. The
remaining two members of the Department shall be members of the City Council
and shall be appointed by the Mayor with the approval and consent of the City
Council. Each of the appointments shall be for a period of one year. The
Director of the Department of Urban Development shall receive such compensation
as may be approved by the City Council.
(Prior Code, § 32.015) (Ord. 68-O-699, passed - -1968; Ord. 72-O-798, passed -
-1972)
§ 32.016 DUTIES.
   It shall be the duty of the Department of Urban Development to institute,
formulate, recommend and process programs in cooperation with state and federal
agencies consistent with the orderly development of the city.
(Prior Code, § 32.016) (Ord. 68-O-699, passed - -1968)
§ 32.017 POWERS.
   The Department of Urban Development shall have authority to institute
programs for the following purposes:
   (A)   The elimination and prevention of slums and blight whether residential
or non-residential, and the removal of the factors that create slums and
blighting conditions;
   (B)   Provide neighborhood facilities for programs of health, recreation,
social or similar necessary community services;
   (C)   Acquisition and development of land for open space uses in carrying
out urban beautification programs;
   (D)   Provide and improve urban mass transportation facilities and
equipment;
   (E)   Participation in Model Cities Program; and
   (F)   Any other program consistent with the proposed urban development of
the city.
(Prior Code, § 32.017) (Ord. 68-O-699, passed - -1968)
BUILDING AND HOUSING DEPARTMENT
§ 32.030 ESTABLISHMENT.
   This subchapter combines the Building Department and the Department of
Housing.
(Ord. 08-O-1921, passed 4-16-2008)
§ 32.031 PURPOSE.
   (A)   The purpose of the Building and Housing Department shall be to concern
itself with all aspects of housing management within the city. It shall track
building inspections, the results of such inspections. It shall maintain an
inventory of the housing stock within the city, which includes, but is not
limited to, the identification of structures, their owners and their state of
repair. It shall keep track of proceedings when a house is to be sold or
ownership transferred, lit shall make sure that all necessary inspections are
carried out, with the results filed, that all necessary documents are issued
and all fees due the city are paid.
   (B)   It shall review applications for build permits in order to determine
whether or not the proposed structure is compatible with the neighborhood and
with the comprehensive plan of the city. It shall conduct studies to identify
housing problems existing within the city and to undertake to conduct meetings,
institute and conduct educational and other programs with groups dedicated to
promoting and improving the standards of living in this community.
(Ord. 08-O-1921, passed 4-16-2008)
§ 32.032 QUALIFICATIONS.
   The Director of Building and Housing shall have: certifications in home
inspections, commercial inspections, new construction, blueprint reading and
food and sanitation inspections; two to five years of knowledge of construction
and plan review or educational equivalent; familiarity with computer
applications (Word, Excel and the like) and possess excellent written and
verbal communication ability. The Director of Building and Housing must also
have good supervisory and customer service skills. Can understand and apply
various process, procedures and ordinances. Capable of preparing and tracking
budgets and must be able to enforce city codes with firmness and tact.
(Ord. 08-O-1921, passed 4-16-2008)
§ 32.033 OATH AND BOND.
   Before entering upon the duties of this office, the Director of Building and
Housing shall take and subscribe the oath of office and shall execute,
acknowledge and deliver to the city a good and sufficient bond with two or more
sureties conditioned for the faithful discharge of the duties of his or her
office in the penal sum of $5,000. The bond shall meet with the approval of the
City Council.
(Ord. 08-O-1921, passed 4-16-2008)
§ 32.034 DUTIES.
   (A)   It shall be the duty of the Director of Building and Housing to see to
the enforcement of all ordinance provisions relating to building and zoning and
to inspect all buildings or structures being erected or altered as frequently
as may be necessary to ensure compliance with the ordinances of the city.
   (B)   The Director of Building and Housing shall devote such time to their
duties as shall be necessary for the efficient operation of the Building and
Housing Department. The office of Director of Building and Housing is a full-
time position.
(Ord. 08-O-1921, passed 4-16-2008)
§ 32.035 REPORTS AND RECORDS.
   The Director of Building and Housing shall submit a report to the City
Council not less than once a month covering the work of the Building and
Housing Department during the preceding period. The Director of Building and
Housing shall incorporate in said report a summary of his or her
recommendations as to desirable amendments to the law.
(Ord. 08-O-1921, passed 4-16-2008)
§ 32.036 POWERS.
   (A)   The Director of Building and Housing is authorized and empowered to
enforce all ordinance provisions relating to building and zoning and to inspect
construction, equipment, alteration, repair, moving or demolition of all
buildings and other structures.
   (B)   (1)   The Director of Building and Housing shall have the power to
make or cause to be made, entry to any building or premises, when necessary in
the performance of his or her duties at any reasonable hour; for such purpose,
they shall have the powers of a police officer.
      (2)   The Director of Building and Housing shall have authority to call
upon the Police Department for aid and assistance, and it shall be the duty of
the Police Department, when so called upon, to cooperate with the Director of
Building and Housing in order to enforce the provisions of the ordinances of
the city.
   (C)   The Director of Building and Housing shall have the power to order all
work stopped on construction or alteration or repair of buildings in the city,
when such work is being done in violation of any provision of any ordinance
relating thereto or in violation of the Zoning Code. Work shall not be resumed
after the issuance of such an order, except on the written permission of the
Director of Building and Housing; provided that, if the stop order is an oral
one, it shall be followed by a written stop order within an hour. Such written
stop order may be served by any police officer.
   (D)   (1)   If a builder has built a number of homes in a subdivision,
contrary to the provisions of the Building Code, the Director of Building and
Housing may order the work stopped on all homes in the same subdivision until
such time as the deficiencies are remedied.
      (2)   The stop order shall be delivered in writing to any persons engaged
in the construction of any of the homes in the subdivision, and all such
persons shall stop work until permitted to proceed by action of the Director of
Building and Housing.
(Ord. 08-O-1921, passed 4-16-2008)
§ 32.037 INDEMNIFICATION.
   Whenever the Director of Building and Housing is acting for the city in the
discharge of his or her official duties under this subchapter and shall, by
reason of any official, act or in the performance of such duty, be subjected to
any suit such suit shall be defended by the City Attorney at the cost of the
city until the final determination of the proceedings thereunder.
(Ord. 08-O-1921, passed 4-16-2008)
§ 32.038 COMPENSATION.
   The Director of Building and Housing shall receive as compensation for the
services rendered an amount as may be determined by the City Council by
ordinance.
(Ord. 08-O-1921, passed 4-16-2008)
§ 32.039 NON-COMPLIANCE WITH ORDERS.
   No person, firm or corporation shall violate any of the provisions of the
ordinances of the city or any order of a duly appointed Director of Building
and Housing.
(Ord. 08-O-1921, passed 4-16-2008)
BOARD OF HEALTH
§ 32.055 CREATION OF BOARD.
   (A)   There is created and established a Board of Health for the city.
   (B)   The Board shall consist of the Mayor, who shall be ex officio
president of the Board of Health, and the Council members.
(Prior Code, § 32.060) (Ord. 541, passed - -1964)
§ 32.056 MEETINGS.
   The Board of Health shall meet at such times and places as it may determine.
(Prior Code, § 32.061) (Ord. 541, passed - -1964)
§ 32.057 ATTENDANCE OF HEALTH OFFICER.
   The Board of Health may require the Health Officer to attend any of its
meetings, and to give to the Board such information or advice as it may desire.
(Prior Code, § 32.062) (Ord. 541, passed - -1964)
§ 32.058 RULES AND REGULATIONS.
   (A)   (1)   The Board of Health shall have the power to make reasonable
rules and regulations for the protection and betterment of the health of the
residents of the city for the abatement of nuisances to health, and for the
prevention and suppression of disease.
      (2)   Such rules and regulations shall take effect and be in force ten
days after publication in a newspaper of general circulation in the city,
except in cases of emergency as provided for in this chapter.
   (B)   In case of contagious or epidemic disease, or of danger from
anticipated or impending contagious or epidemic disease, or in case the
sanitary condition of the city is so dangerous as to warrant it, it shall be
the duty of the Board of Health to make such rules and regulations, to take
such measures, and to do and order to be done and cause to be done such acts
for the preservation of the public health (though not herein or elsewhere or
otherwise specifically authorized) as it may in good faith believe to be
necessary and may declare such rules and regulations to be emergency rules and
regulations that shall take effect immediately, or as soon as may be, after the
promulgation of the same by the Board.
   (C)   The emergency rules and regulations shall also be published in such
manner as the Board determines, with notice that they are in force in the city.
(Prior Code, § 32.063) (Ord. 541, passed - -1964)
§ 32.059 POLICE DEPARTMENT TO AID BOARD OF HEALTH.
   It shall be the duty of every member of the Police Department to aid in the
enforcement of any order issued by the authority of the Board of Health.
(Prior Code, § 32.064) (Ord. 541, passed - -1964)
BOARD OF LOCAL IMPROVEMENTS
§ 32.070 CREATION OF BOARD.
   There is created a Board of Local Improvements for the city consisting of
five members.
(Prior Code, § 32.075) (Ord. 74-O-848, passed - -1974)
§ 32.071 APPOINTMENT.
   (A)   The five members of the Board of Local Improvements shall be appointed
by the Mayor and shall be confirmed by the City Council.
   (B)   The members of the Board of Local Improvements shall consist of:
      (1)   The Mayor, who shall be President of the Board;
      (2)   The City Engineer;
      (3)   The Superintendent of Public Works; and
      (4)   Two members of the City Council.
(Prior Code, § 32.076) (Ord. 74-O-848, passed - -1974)
§ 32.072 DUTIES AND POWERS.
   The Board of Local Improvements of the city shall have the powers and duties
and perform the duties assigned to it by the statutes of the state and by the
code and ordinances of the city.
(Prior Code, § 32.077) (Ord. 74-O-848, passed - -1974)
BOARD OF EXAMINERS AND APPEALS
§ 32.085 CREATION OF BOARD.
   There is created a Board of Examiners and Appeals consisting of three
members to be appointed by the Mayor and City Council.
(Prior Code, § 32.090) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 32.086 QUALIFICATIONS.
   (A)   The members of the Board of Examiners and Appeals shall be persons who
are qualified by experience and training to pass upon matters pertaining to
building construction.
   (B)   In addition to the three appointed members, the Director of Building
and Housing shall be an ex officio member and shall act as Secretary to the
Board, but shall not have a right to vote.
(Prior Code, § 32.091) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 32.087 DUTIES.
   (A)   It shall be the duty of the Board of Examiners and Appeals to
determine the suitability of alternate materials and types of construction and
to provide for reasonable interpretation of the provisions of the Building Code
of the city.
   (B)   The Board shall adopt reasonable rules and regulations for conducting
its investigations and shall render all decisions and findings in writing to
the Building Department.
(Prior Code, § 32.092) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 32.088 POWER TO REQUEST TESTS AS PROOF OF COMPLIANCE.
   Whenever there is evidence that any material or construction does not
conform with the requirements of this subchapter or in order to substantiate
claims for alternate materials or methods of construction, the Board of
Examiners and Appeals may require tests as proof of compliance to be made at
the expense of the owner or his or her agent by an approved agency.
(Prior Code, § 32.093) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 32.089 APPROVAL OF SUBMITTED PLANS AND SPECIFICATIONS FOR BUILDING PERMIT.
   (A)   (1)   Before application may be made for a building permit for any
work covered by this code, two copies of the working drawings and
specifications shall be submitted to the Board of Examiners and Appeals by
filing same with the City Clerk.
      (2)   The Board of Examiners will either approve the design thus
presented, or if the approval is withheld, will confer with the owner of the
proposed structure, or his or her duly authorized representative, in a helpful
and advisory conference.
   (B)   After the return to the owner of one copy of the drawings and
specifications, application may be made for a building permit.
(Prior Code, § 32.094) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
§ 32.090 NON-COMPLIANCE WITH ORDERS.
   No person, firm or corporation shall violate any of the provisions of this
subchapter or any order of a duly appointed inspector.
(Prior Code, § 32.095) (Ord. 68-O-697, passed - -1968)
BOARD OF FIRE AND POLICE COMMISSIONERS
§ 32.105 APPOINTMENT; DUTIES.
   The city adopts by reference, as though fully set forth in this subchapter
the provisions of 65 ILCS 5/10-2.1-1 et seq., provided for the appointment and
duties of a Board of Fire and Police Commissioners, except that the Board shall
consist of five members.
(Prior Code, § 32.105) (Ord. 19-O-2214, passed 1-2-2019)
HUMAN RELATIONS COMMISSION
§ 32.120 ESTABLISHMENT.
   There is established and created a Commission on Human Relations for the
city.
(Prior Code, § 32.115) (Ord. 584, passed - -1965)
§ 32.121 MEMBERSHIP; ORGANIZATION.
   The Commission on Human Relations shall consist of 18 members, all of whom
shall be legal residents of the city and they shall be representative of all
segments of the community: religious, racial, educational, labor, civic and
management. The Mayor, City Attorney, head of the Police Department ad the
Chairperson of Public Safety Committee shall be ex officio members.
(Prior Code, § 32.116) (Ord. 584, passed - -1965; Ord. 19-O-2240, passed 10-2-
2019)
§ 32.122 APPOINTMENT; TERM.
   Annually, the Mayor and City Council, voting jointly, shall appoint six
members who shall hold their office for the term of three years, or until their
successors are appointed, unless sooner removed for cause.
(Prior Code, § 32.117) (Ord. 584, passed - -1965)
§ 32.123 OFFICIALS; RULES OF ORDER.
   (A)   The Human Relations Commission may elect from its members a
Chairperson, a Secretary and such officers as may be necessary and shall adopt
rules of order concerning meetings, committees, quorums, rules of procedure as
to them shall seem advisable.
   (B)   The meetings may be called by the Chairperson or any three members of
the Commission.
   (C)   The facilities of the municipal building shall be available to the
Commission for such meetings.
(Prior Code, § 32.118) (Ord. 584, passed - -1965)
§ 32.124 DUTIES AND FUNCTIONS.
   (A)   The duties of the Human Relations Commission are to work as an
investigative, consultative, cooperative, educational and promotional and
advisory agency in the promotion of harmonious human rights under law.
   (B)   (1)   The functions of the Commission shall be to investigate
intergroup tensions and specific cases of racial or religious or other serious
discrimination in this community.
      (2)   It shall seek to use its availability as consultant to bring about
better understanding and justice between disputant ethnic or religious factions
within our community. It shall cooperate with local agencies and other
authorities in lawful preservation of human rights. It may initiate or conduct
any educational or information programs it believes will further the purposes
for which it has been established. It may recommend executive and/or
legislative action to the Mayor and City Council. It shall be available as an
advisory board to the Mayor and City Council.
   (C)   Results of the investigations and resulting recommendations for
progressively improving human relations in the entire city shall be made in
report form to the Mayor and City Council. A copy of the minutes of all
meetings of the Commission shall be filed with the City Clerk.
(Prior Code, § 32.119) (Ord. 584, passed - -1965)
§ 32.125 COMPENSATION AND EXPENSES.
   The members of the Human Relations Commission shall serve without
compensation, but shall be given such expenses for operation and conduct of the
affairs as may be necessary by funds provided in the annual city appropriation
ordinance.
(Prior Code, § 32.120) (Ord. 584, passed - -1965)
PLANNING AND ZONING BOARD OF APPEALS
§ 32.140 ESTABLISHMENT.
   The Plan Commission and Zoning Board of Appeals is hereby established in the
city.
(Ord. 09-O-1950, passed 6-3-2009)
§ 32.141 MEMBERSHIP; TERM OF OFFICE.
   (A)   The Plan Commission and Zoning Board of Appeals shall consist of five
members, which include the Chairperson who are residents of the city, appointed
by the Mayor with approval of the City Council.
   (B)   All members appointed to the Plan Commission and Zoning Board of
Appeals shall hold their office until their successor is appointed.
(Ord. 09-O-1950, passed 6-3-2009; Ord. 22-O-2324, passed 1-19-2022)

and duties as set forth in the city’s code of ordinances as the Plan Commission
and the Zoning Board of Appeals held separately.
(Ord. 09-O-1950, passed 6-3-2009)
ELECTRICAL COMMISSION
§ 32.155 ESTABLISHMENT; ORGANIZATION.
   (A)   There is established a commission which shall be known as the
Electrical Commission of the city which shall be composed of five members as
follows.
      (1)   The Chief Electrical Inspector of the city shall be a members and
ex officio Chairperson of the Commission.
      (2)   One member shall be an electrical contractor.
      (3)   One member shall be a journeyman electrician.
      (4)   One member shall be a representative of an inspection bureau
maintained by the fire underwriters if such member resides in the municipality;
if no such member resides in the municipality, then the Chief of the Fire
Department.
      (5)   One member shall be a representative of an electrical supply
company.
   (B)   If there is no person residing in the city who is qualified under any
of the descriptions set forth in division (A) above, the Mayor may appoint some
other person to fill that position by and with the advice and consent of the
corporate authorities.
   (C)   All members of the Electrical Commission shall be appointed by the
Mayor by and with the consent of the corporate authorities.
   (D)   (1)   It shall be the duty of the Commission to formulate and
recommend safe and practical standards and specifications for the installation,
alteration and use of electrical equipment designed to meet the necessities and
conditions that prevail in the city, to recommend reasonable rules and
regulations governing the issuance of permits by the Electrical Inspection
Division and to recommend reasonable fees to be paid for inspections made by
the Electrical Inspection Division.
      (2)   The standards and specifications, rules and regulations governing
the issuance of permits and fees so recommended, shall become effective upon
the passage of an ordinance adopting the same by the City Council.
(Prior Code, § 32.150) (Ord. 580, passed - -)

LICENSE COMMISSION
§ 32.185 ESTABLISHMENT OF COMMISSION.
   (A)   There is established a City License Commission which shall consist of
three members to be appointed by the Mayor with the approval of the City
Council. At the time of making the original appointments, one appointment shall
be for a term of one year, one for two years and one for three years and the
successors to each member so appointed shall serve for a term of three years.
The Mayor shall annually designate one of the members to act as Chairperson and
it shall be the duty of the Chairperson to call and conduct the meetings of the
License Commission.
   (B)   Subject to the supervision and direction of the corporate authorities,
it shall be the duty of the License Commission to administer and enforce the
provisions of Title XI of this code of ordinances.
   (C)   Payment of all expenses incurred by the License Commission must be
approved by the corporate authorities.
(Prior Code, § 32.175) (Ord. 67-O-673, passed - -1967; Ord. 70-O-757, passed -
-1970)
§ 32.186 DUTIES.
   (A)   It shall be the duty of the city’s License Commission to do the
following:
      (1)   Promulgate and enforce all reasonable rules and regulations
necessary to the operation and enforcement of Title XI of this code;
      (2)   Adopt all forms and prescribe the information to be given therein
as to character and other relevant matter or all necessary papers;
      (3)   Require applicants to submit all affidavits and oaths necessary to
the administration of this title;
      (4)   Submit all applications, in a proper case, to interest city
officials for their endorsements thereon as to compliance by the applicant with
all city regulations which they have the duty of enforcing;
      (5)   Investigate, or cause to be investigated, and determine the
eligibility of any applicant for a license as prescribed in Title XI;
      (6)   Examine the books and records, or cause to be examined the books
and records, of any applicant or licensee when reasonably necessary to the
administration and enforcement of Title XI;
      (7)   Inspect, or cause to be inspected, and determine the eligibility
and compliance to the city code and any applicable ordinances of any premises
used for or in connection with the operation of a licensed business or
occupation; and
      (8)   To conduct hearings in accordance with recognized parliamentary
procedure whenever it be necessary to determine the eligibility of an applicant
to receive a license or to determine the justification for a suspension or
revocation of a license for violation of the city code or any city ordinances.
   (B)   (1)   For the purpose of conciliating complaints of discrimination,
the city’s License Commission or other administrative agencies may hold closed
meetings and shall not be subject to the provisions of “An Act In Relation To
Meetings” approved 7-11-1957, being 5 ILCS 120, as amended.
      (2)   No final action for the imposition or recommendation of a penalty
shall be taken, except at a meeting open to the public.
   (C)   To make recommendations to the Mayor concerning the issuance,
suspension and revocation of all business licenses subject to the provisions of
§§
32.001 through
32.003 of this code of ordinances, upon request of the Mayor to furnish written
reports concerning these recommendations.
   (D)   The city’s License Commission shall keep a register of all licenses
issued, entering therein the name of the person or persons licensed, the date
of the license, the business or purpose for which it is granted, the number and
kinds of vehicles, if any, and the number of bowling alleys and billiard or
pool tables covered by it, if any, the amount of the license fee paid and, if
transferred, the date of the transfer and the name of the person to whom it is
transferred.
(Prior Code, § 32.176) (Ord. 67-O-673, passed - -1967; Ord. 70-O-757, passed -
-1970)
§ 32.187 INFORMATION TO BE KEPT CONFIDENTIAL.
   (A)   The License Commission shall keep all information furnished or secured
under the authority of Title XI of this code in strict confidence.
   (B)   Such information shall not be subject to public inspection and shall
be kept so that the contents thereof shall not become known, except to the
